description: The budget approved by the Republican-led House includes over $9.5 billion for Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
title: House appropriations bill would increase border enforcement capacity

description: We go to a town in Eastern Ukraine that is close to the front lines and under constant fire. Russians are advancing in Eastern Ukraine as Ukrainian forces run low on ammunition and weapons.
title: A Visit to a Town Under Fire in Eastern Ukraine

description: Assistant Secretary of State Bill Russo told Israeli officials last week the Gaza war is damaging Israel's global reputation, potentially lasting a generation, according to a readout obtained by NPR.
title: A State Department official warns Israel of 'major' reputational damage in Gaza war

description: A new Indiana law requires professors to promote "intellectual diversity" to receive tenure. Critics worry the measure will dissuade academics from staying in the state.
title: New Indiana law requires professors to promote 'intellectual diversity' to keep tenure

description: Reports from Moscow say two to five gunmen attacked a concert hall outside the capital. A fire broke out after the attack. According to Tass news agency, some people remain trapped in the building.
title: Deaths and injuries are reported after an attack on a concert hall outside Moscow

description: Reporter Jake Adelstein's memoir about covering the organized crime beat in Japan is the basis of the Max series Tokyo Vice, now in its second season. Originally broadcast Nov. 9, 2009.
title: An American reporter offers a first-hand account of Japan's toughest crime bosses

description: "We want answers, accountability, and safer planes" — and a federal investigation will help, an attorney representing passengers who were on the plane that lost its door plug tells NPR.
title: FBI letter tells Alaska Airlines passengers they are 'a possible victim of a crime'

description: This change follows the recent FDA approval of the weight-loss drug for preventing heart attack and stroke in people with overweight or obesity.
title: Medicare plans can now cover Wegovy for patients at risk of heart disease

description: A settlement by the National Realtors Association promises to change the way real estate agents are compensated. It could spell an end to 6% commissions, which are higher than people pay elsewhere.
title: Buying or selling a home? How the real estate fee structure impacts you

description: Blinken's sixth time in the region since the Oct. 7 Hamas attacks on Israel comes as cease-fire and hostage release talks continue in Doha, Qatar, and Russia and China veto U.S. cease-fire resolution.
title: Blinken meets with Netanyahu in Israel as Gaza cease-fire resolution fails at the U.N.

description: Only seven states have legalized human composting as a burial practice. That's why 29 percent of the bodies brought to Recompose, a composting facility in Seattle, come from out of state.
title: The ultimate green burial? Human composting lets you replenish the earth after death

description: The company behind Trump's Truth Social is on the verge of going public. It could earn the former president billions of dollars at a time when he faces mounting legal problems.
title: Trump is on the verge of a windfall of billions of dollars. Here are 3 things to know

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken makes his sixth visit to Israel since the war in Gaza began. The DOJ is suing Apple, alleging the tech giant is abusing its power as a monopoly.
title: Blinken visits Israel amid tensions over Rafah invasion plan; DOJ sues Apple

description: For a decade, Florida lawmakers have debated whether to expand Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act. Advocates are trying to circumvent the legislature and take the issue directly to voters.
title: A push is underway for voters to make Florida the next state to expand Medicaid

description: The Ukrainian energy minister said the nighttime drone and rocket attacks were "the largest attack on the Ukrainian energy sector in recent times." At least three people were killed, officials said.
title: Russia attacks Ukrainian electrical power facilities, causing widespread outages

description: The Ensuring Likeness Voice and Image Security Act, or ELVIS Act, is an updated version of the state's right of publicity law. The new legislation includes AI-specific protections.
title: Tennessee becomes the first state to protect musicians and other artists against AI

description: Boeing made big promises to the Justice Department to avoid prosecution after two fatal crashes of 737 Max jets. That deal now faces heightened scrutiny after a door plug blew off a jet in midair.
title: As the DOJ investigates Boeing, crash victims' families wonder why it's taken so long

description: Religions hold a variety of views toward IVF. Catholicism has one of the strongest negative judgments against the practice. Yet many in the church still use the procedure in order to have children.
title: Despite church prohibitions, Catholics still choose IVF to have children

description: Last year's most popular dog is still top, and the happiest nation is still the most contented. March is still madness and shutdowns still loom.
title: This week's quiz has happiness and happy dogs. You're welcome

description: Arvind Kejriwal, New Delhi's top elected official, was arrested Thursday amid accusations his party and ministers accepted bribes. Opposition parties say it's part of a crackdown by Modi's government.
title: Supporters of arrested Indian opposition politician protest in New Delhi

description:
Across the animal kingdom, menopause is something of an evolutionary blip. We humans are one of the few animals to experience it. But Sam Ellis, a researcher in animal behavior, argues that this isn't so surprising. "The best way to propagate your genes is to get as many offspring as possible into the next generation," says Ellis. "The best way to do that is almost always to reproduce your whole life."

So how did menopause evolve? The answer may lie in whales. Ellis and his team at the University of Exeter recently published a study in the journal Nature that studies the evolution of menopause in the undersea animals most known for it. What they uncovered may even help explain menopause in humans.

Curious about other animal behavior mysteries? Email us at
title: Most animals don't go through menopause. So why do these whales?

description: Since three months have passed without a winner, the Mega Millions jackpot has grown to an estimated $977 million. The jackpot ranks as the 10th largest in U.S. lottery history
title: Friday's Mega Millions jackpot soars to nearly $1 billion. Here's what to know

description: Nex, a nonbinary teen, died by suicide after a high school fight. The Tulsa County District Attorney says the fight was mutual and there's not enough evidence to press charges.
title: Oklahoma prosecutors will not press charges in Nex Benedict case
